captions.text: Impressive!
You upgraded your armor.
Ive made a few adjustments of my own.

Wow... Are you kidding me with that takeoff
speed??
Umm.. It takes a while!
But, I'll catch you.
Are you sure about that?

I mean, have you even flown in
that thing before?
Not exactly.
But I assure you it's more advanced in every way.
Oh well, if you say it's more advanced, then by all means I guess I'll just surrender right-- tank missile!
Careful man, that's a brand new suit here!
(explosion)
So you just killed him?
Yea, I mean it was either that or have Pepper do it for me.
So I just decided to take all the credit.
That's sort of arrogant and thoughtful.

But still, you just killed him off. That's
pretty dark...

I mean you knew the guy almost your
whole life.
He tried to kill me.. twice.

And haven't you learned yet that if you
put your super villain in prison,
they just vow revenge and just break out again?
Yea that, that never happens.
So after you killed him what happened?

Well after that, I have had a press
conference and told the world I'm Iron Man.
What?!
Dude!

You can't give away your secret
identity!
Why not? Because I did and I'm awesome.
So.. in your face.

You just can't. I mean you're
not supposed to.
Ehh, I like the attention.
And you mean to tell me, you've never revealed your secret identity before?
Ahh, no..
HA! Try every girl you've ever dated!
What?
Oh I'm Bruce Wayne and I like you.
Let me tell you my big secret.
Oh you're one to talk!
Mr. Mind Eraser.
Oh, don't even!
I will freeze breath your face off.
No you won't.
You're right, I won't. I love this guy... Up top!
But you know I could've high fived you into the ground just now, right?
Guys, guys. It's not a contest.
Because I think we all know who would win if it were..
Me.
Oh, whatever!
I'm Batman.
Let's arm wrestle right now.
Hey!
How come you guys never ask me to hang out?

title: How Iron Man Should Have Ended

comments.text:
I hope Marvel and DC make a successful "Gauntlet Wars" movie later on.

For those that don't know; the "Gauntlet Wars" was a long comic arc about 
Thanos (that purple guy at the end of "The Avengers") using the "Infinity 
Gauntlet" (a gauntlet infused with the combined power of ancient 
power-sources, including the ones in "The Avengers" and "Thor: The Dark 
World") to shift the Marvel and DC universes together, causing a cross-over 
war between every character, then attempts to kill everyone.

What's funny is the fact that Thanos does all of this just to impress Death 
so she'll love him. xD﻿

comments.text:
Because in Superman II, Superman kisses Lois Lane and it somehow makes her 
forget his secret identity. His kiss erased her mind and she forgot 
everything about the last couple of days, including Superman's secret 
identity. They never bother to explain where this power suddenly came from, 
though, so it's become something of a joke among fans.

comments.text:
Well Vibranium is the only element that can efficiently power him and the 
suits without killing him, anything else like Palladium would give him 
nuclear radiation and kill him slowly so Kryptonite would have to be both 
magnetic (which it doesn't look like it is) and be nuclear isolated (which 
it could be) but either way the Arc Reactor only powers the suit (unless 
you count that Chest Beam but I don't think it would be like a Kryptonite 
Blast) just watch the second movie and you'll understand it

comments.text:
+Adam Reed Yeah, but yet he failed to prevent his paladium intoxication in 
MCU in Iron Man 2 when it was as easy as using lead, as you can see the 
abilities of fictitious characters come and go as plot demands it and 
they're not necessarily 100% supported by scientific explanations, so 
whether if Startk could use kryptonite to power up an Iron Man suit is an 
answer we could not obtain unless someone made another crossover and touch 
the point.
